lines.content: * {@link Duke} is the main class of this program.
* Constructor for {@link Duke} to initialize the storage or
* get task list from the storage.
* @param filePath the file path of the storage.
* Launch the program and initiate the command loop to process user input.
* It displays a greeting message by calling the {@link GreetCommand}.
* The program's main function to start the application.
* @param args the arguments passed into the application.
* Command to add a {@link Task} to the {@link TaskList}.
* Constructs an {@link AddTaskCommand} object with the specified {@link Task} and {@link TaskList}.
* This command is used to add a new task to the given task list.
* @param task The task to be added, in the form of {@code ToDo}, {@code Event} or {@code Deadline}.
* @param taskList The task list to which the task will be added.
* Executes the {@link AddTaskCommand}, performing the necessary actions to carry out the specific functionality
* This method adds the given task to the task list, update the storage and display the add task message by
* @param storage The storage object that manages the data persistence. It is used to update
*                and save changes after executing the command.
* The {@link Command} class is an abstract base class representing a generic command in a
* command-pattern-based design. Subclasses of this class provide concrete implementations
* for the {@code execute} method to define specific behaviors.
* Executes the {@link Command}, performing the necessary actions to carry out the specific functionality
* @param storage The storage object that manages the data persistence. It is used to update
*                and save changes after executing the command.
* Command to delete a {@link Task} from the {@link TaskList} using the task index.
* Constructs a {@link DeleteTaskCommand} object with the specified {@link Task} index and {@link TaskList}.
* This command is used to delete a task from the given task list.
* @param index The index of the task to be deleted.
* @param taskList The task list to which the task will be deleted.
* Executes the {@link DeleteTaskCommand}, performing the necessary actions to carry out the specific functionality
* This method deletes the given task index from the task list, update the storage and display the delete task
* message by initialising the delete task view.
* @param storage The storage object that manages the data persistence. It is used to update
*                and save changes after executing the command.
* Executes the {@link ExitCommand}, print exit message when the program is terminated.
* This method display the exit message by initialising the exit view.
* @param storage The storage object that manages the data persistence. It is not used in {@link ExitCommand}
* Command to list out filtered tasks in the {@link TaskList} based on user's input.
* Constructs a {@link FindTaskCommand} object using user's input and {@link TaskList}.
* This command is used to list filtered tasks in the given task list based on user's input.
* @param title The user's desired find task keyword.
* @param taskList The task list which requires filtering.
* Executes the {@link FindTaskCommand}, filter a {@link TaskList} based on user's input and
* @param storage The storage object that manages the data persistence. It is not used in {@link FindTaskCommand}
* Command to greet user when program is started.
* Executes the {@link GreetCommand}, print a welcome message greeting the user.
* This method display the exit message by initialising the exit view.
* @param storage The storage object that manages the data persistence. It is not used in {@link GreetCommand}
* The {@link InvalidCommand} class represents a command to handle invalid user input.
* Constructs an {@link InvalidCommand} with a default exception message.
this.exception = new DukeException("I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(").getMessage();
* Executes the {@link InvalidCommand}, print the error message when user input is invalid.
* This method display the error message by printing out the exception message.
* @param storage The storage object that manages the data persistence. It is not used in {@link ExitCommand}
* Command to list out all tasks in the {@code TaskList}.
* Constructs a {@link ListTaskCommand} object using {@link TaskList}.
* This command is used to list all tasks in the given task list.
* @param taskList The task list to be listed .
* This method display the task list using the task list view.
* @param storage The storage object that manages the data persistence. It is not used in {@link ListTaskCommand}
* Command to mark a {@link Task} as done.
* Constructs a {@link MarkTaskCommand} object with the specified {@link Task} index and {@link TaskList}.
* This command is used to mark a task as done from the given task list.
* @param index The index of the task to be marked as done.
* @param taskList The task list to which the task will be marked.
* Executes the {@link MarkTaskCommand}, performing the necessary actions to carry out the specific functionality
* This method marks the given task as done from the task list, update the storage and display the mark task
* message by initialising the mark task view.
* @param storage The storage object that manages the data persistence. It is used to update
*                and save changes after executing the command.
* Command to mark a {@link Task} as not done.
* Constructs a {@link UnmarkTaskCommand} object with the specified {@link Task} index and {@link TaskList}.
* This command is used to mark a task as not done from the given task list.
* @param index The index of the task to be marked as not done.
* @param taskList The task list to which the task will be marked.
* Executes the {@link UnmarkTaskCommand}, performing the necessary actions to carry out the specific functionality
* This method marks the given task as not done from the task list, update the storage and display the unmark task
* message by initialising the unmark task view.
* @param storage The storage object that manages the data persistence. It is used to update
*                and save changes after executing the command.
* The {@link DukeException} class represents a custom exception specific to the Duke application.
* It extends the standard {@link Exception} class and provides a constructor to initialize the
* exception message in a stylized format.
* Constructs a {@link DukeException} with a formatted exception message.
* @param exception The specific error message associated with the exception.
* The {@link Parser} class is responsible for parsing user input and extracting relevant information
* to perform actions within the program.
* Constructs a {@link Parser} with the specified command string and {@link TaskList}.
* @param command The raw command string provided by the user for parsing.
* @param taskList The {@code TaskList} associated with the parser, providing context for command execution.
* Parse user input and return the corresponding command based on user's input.
* @return a {@code Command} based on user's input.
* @throws DukeException if user enters an invalid input.
* @return a {@code ToDo} based on user's input.
* @throws DukeException if user left the description empty.
private static ToDo parseToDo(String[] todo) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("The description of a todo cannot be empty.");

* @param title The title of the deadline task.
* @param date The deadline date and time.
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task, including its type, title, and deadline details.
* @return A formatted string representing the deadline task.
* The {@link Event} class represents a task with a specific time range.

* @param title The title of the event task.
* @param from The start time of the event.
* @param to The end time of the event.

* The {@link Task} class is an abstract base class representing a generic task in the Duke application.
* It implements the {@link Serializable} interface to support object serialization.
public abstract class Task implements Serializable {
* Constructs a {@link Task} instance with the specified title. By default, the task is marked as not done.
* @param title The title of the task.
* Returns a string representation of the task, including its status (done or not) and title.
* @return A formatted string representing the task.
* Mark the task as not completed.

* @return {@code true} if the task is done, {@code false} otherwise.
* Returns the title of the task.
* The {@link TaskList} class encapsulates a task list and provides methods to
* Constructs an empty {@link TaskList} with an initial capacity of 100.

* Returns the task at the specified index in the list.
* @param index The index of the task to retrieve.
* @return The task at the specified index.
* Adds a task to the list.
* @param task The task to be added.
* Removes a task from the list.
* @param task The task to be removed.
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.

* Returns the filtered task list based on user's input.

* Returns a string representation of the ToDo task, including its type and title.
* @return A formatted string representing the ToDo task.
* The {@link AddTaskView} class represents a view for displaying information after adding a {@link Task}.

+ "   Got it. I've added this task:\n"
+ "   Now you have " + this.size + " tasks in the list.\n"
* The {@link DeleteTaskView} class represents a view for displaying information after deleting a {@link Task}.

* The {@link ExitView} class represents a view for displaying a farewell message upon exiting the application.

* The {@link FindTaskView} class represents a view for displaying the list of filtered tasks.
* Constructs a {@link FindTaskView} with the specified task list.

* Displays the list of filtered tasks along with an introductory message and a formatted task list.
"Here are the matching tasks in your list:\n"
* The {@link GreetView} class represents a view for displaying a welcome message upon starting the application.
* Displays a welcome message when the program is started.
+ "   Hello! I'm Iggly, your personal assistant chatbot.\n"
+ "   What can I do for you?\n"
* The {@link MarkTaskView} class represents a view for displaying information after marking a task as done.

* @param task The task that has been marked as done.
* Displays information about the marked task, including its details and the updated status.
+ " Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n"
* The {@link TaskListView} class represents a view for displaying the list of tasks.
* Constructs a {@link TaskListView} with the specified task list.
* @param taskList The {@link TaskList} containing the tasks to be displayed.
* Displays the list of tasks along with an introductory message and a formatted task list.
* The {@link Ui} class is an abstract base class representing the user interface in the Duke application.
* Displays information or messages to the user.
* The {@link UnmarkTaskView} class represents a view for displaying information after marking a task as not done.
* Constructs a {@link UnmarkTaskView} with the specified task.
* @param task The task that has been marked as not done.
* Displays information about the unmarked task, including its details and the updated status.
+ " OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:\n"
